SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.google.code.gwt.database.client
Interface TransactionCallback

public interface TransactionCallback

Represents callbacks which are invoked when a database transaction is in progress.

First, the onTransactionStart(SQLTransaction) is invoked. In this method you should execute your SQL statements by means of SQLTransaction.executeSql(String, Object[]) calls.

If an error occurs during the transaction (which means: some StatementCallback.onFailure(SQLTransaction, SQLError) callback returned true), onTransactionFailure(SQLError) is invoked. Otherwise (if the transaction completes successfully), onTransactionSuccess() is invoked.

See Also:
W3C Web Database - Transaction steps

Method Summary
 void onTransactionFailure(SQLError error)
          This callback is invoked when the transaction has failed to complete successfully.
 void onTransactionStart(SQLTransaction transaction)
          The implementation of this method should execute the actual SQL transaction by using the specified transaction instance to invoke SQLTransaction.executeSql(String, Object[]).
 void onTransactionSuccess()
          This callback is invoked if all SQL statements in the transaction are committed successfully.
 

Method Detail

onTransactionStart

void onTransactionStart(SQLTransaction transaction)
The implementation of this method should execute the actual SQL transaction by using the specified transaction instance to invoke SQLTransaction.executeSql(String, Object[]).

Parameters:
transaction - the transaction context
See Also:
W3C Web Database - SQLTransactionCallback

onTransactionSuccess

void onTransactionSuccess()
This callback is invoked if all SQL statements in the transaction are committed successfully.

The transaction is closed now. Use this method to proceed with your program.

See Also:
W3C Web Database - SQLVoidCallback

onTransactionFailure

void onTransactionFailure(SQLError error)
This callback is invoked when the transaction has failed to complete successfully.

The transaction is closed now. Use this method to proceed with your program.

See Also:
W3C Web Database - SQLTransactionErrorCallback
